groups.description: RR, IRR and Coefficient of Aggravation
Beta, Unstandardized Regression Weight, IE and DE
The results below do not belong to any Estimator grouping

hr.name: Hazard Ratio
hr.label: HR
hr.description: The chance of an event occurring in the treatment arm : the chance of an event occurring in the control arm

shr.name: Subhazard Ratio
shr.label: SHR
shr.description: The instantaneous rate of occurrence of the given type of event in subjects who have not yet experienced an event of that type

chr.name: Cause-specific Hazard Ratio
chr.label: CHR
chr.description: The relative change in the instantaneous rate of the occurrence of the primary event in subjects who are currently event?free

smr.name: Standardized Mortality Ratio
smr.label: SMR
smr.description: The ratio of observed deaths in the study group to expected deaths in the general population

or.name: Odds Ratio
or.label: OR
or.description: The odds that an outcome will occur given a particular exposure, compared to the odds of the outcome occurring in the absence of that exposure

cor.name: Conditional Odds Ratio
cor.label: COR
cor.description: A measure of the odds ratio between two variables when a third variable is held at a fixed level

rr.name: Risk Ratio
rr.label: RR
rr.description: The ratio of the probability of an outcome in an exposed group to the probability of an outcome in an unexposed group

pr.name: Prevalence Ratio
pr.label: PR
pr.description: A measure of risk that compares the prevalence of a disease in an exposed group to the prevalence in an unexposed group

tr.name: Time Ratio
tr.label: TR
tr.description: Estimate the relationship between nonfatal index self-harm episode characteristics and subsequent nonfatal self-harm and suicide

beta.name: Beta
beta.label: Beta
beta.description: The standardized regression coefficient, which compares the strength of the effect of each individual independent variable to the dependent variable (the higher the absolute value of the beta coefficient, the stronger the effect)

urw.name: Unstandardized Regression Weight
urw.label: URW
urw.description: The amount of change in a dependent variable Y due to a change of 1 unit of independent variable X

r.name: Correlation Coefficient
r.label: R
r.description: A statistical measure of the strength of the relationship between the relative movements of two variables

coa.name: Coefficient of Aggravation
coa.label: COA
coa.description: A ratio of suicide rate among divorced to suicide rate among married groups

oes.name: Overall Effect Size
oes.label: OES
oes.description: The mean difference between groups in standard score form (used in meta-analysis)

ie.name: Indirect Effect Coefficient
ie.label: IE
ie.description: Measures the extent to which the dependent variable changes when the independent variable is held fixed and the mediator variable changes by the amount it would have changed had the independent variable increased by one unit (used in mediation analysis)

de.name: Direct Effect Coefficient
de.label: DE
de.description: Measures the extent to which the dependent variable changes when the independent variable increases by one unit and the mediator variable remains unaltered (used in mediation analysis)

te.name: Total Effect
te.label: TE
te.description: Measures how much two cases that differ by one unit on one variable are estimated to differ on the other variable (used in mediation analysis)

pe.name: Pooled Estimate
pe.label: PE
pe.description: A statistical estimate that combines information from multiple samples to estimate a common mean or variance

smd.name: Standardized Mean Difference
smd.label: SMD
smd.description: A measure of the difference between the means of a variable in relation to its standard deviation

rd.name: Risk Difference
rd.label: RD
rd.description: A measure of the difference in risk between two groups, and is calculated by subtracting the risk in the unexposed group from the risk in the exposed group

spe.name: Standardized Point Estimate
spe.label: SPE
spe.description: A single value that's calculated from sample data to estimate an unknown population parameter

rer.name: Relative Excess Risk
rer.label: RER
rer.description: A measure of comparative risk that is used in epidemiology to show an increased amount of risk compared to a group without risk factors obtained by subtracting 1 from the relative risk
